Description: About one third (mended from 11 fragments and partly restored) of East Greek (North Ionian) Late Wild Goat pottery lid; underside reserved; cream slip; on edge of rim sets of opposed diagonal lines with glaze triangular fill; on top of rim red line; short verticals on flat moulding at edge of lid proper; on the lid, from the (lost) knob out: tongues; two bands; dots; stopt maeander band between broad black bands with added red lines; dots; two lines; animal frieze: goats grazing to left; restrained added red; filling ornaments: rosettes, dotted semi-circles, quatrefoils; inscription cut on top of animal frieze.
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 65, no. 775, pl. XXI, no. 775)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 684, no. 426)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.575)
